alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 4:37AM PST until December 07 at 11:07AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. Nisqually River Near National affecting Lewis and Pierce Counties. .Rain will continue over the Southern Cascades today but will not be heavy enough to be hydrologically significant. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cowlitz River at Randle. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will cause flooding from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...inundating many roads including US Highway 12 and much of the farm lands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 21.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting early this morning near 21.0 feet. The river will remain steady into the early afternoon hours then begin receding. The river will fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1245 PM PST.
